herald.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon
herald.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
herald.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to say publicly that someone or something will be good or important
herald.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: When it opened, the hospital was heralded as a new way forward in nursing care.
herald.translation[1].definitions[0].def: someone who carried messages from a ruler in the past
